title: Compiler drops fn symbols from rlib when not inlined.
body:
### Repro
I tried this code, which I have saved as `repro.rs`:

```rust
#[inline(never)]
fn test_fn() {
}
 
extern "C" fn run_test_fn() {
    // Unfortunately, _ZN5repro7test_fn17hf3114ef58d23fd06E is undefined in the .rlib and
    // linker errors result.
    test_fn();
}
 
#[used]
#[link_section = ".init_array"]
static S_TEST_FN: unsafe extern "C" fn() = run_test_fn;
```

I run this:

```
../../third_party/android_rust_toolchain/toolchain/bin/rustc repro.rs \
  --crate-type rlib --edition=2018 -Copt-level=3 -o repro.rlib

objdump -t repro.rlib |grep test_fn|grep UND
```
### Result

I expected to see this happen:

Normally all the symbols for the functions are present in the rlib's object files. So the grep is empty. However..

Instead, this happened:

With this carefully crafted repro case, the test_fn() (symbol: _ZN15values_unittest7test_fn17h9cefd472d6bb8276E) gets dropped from the rlib's objects and shows as `*UND*` in `objdump`:
```
0000000000000000         *UND*	0000000000000000 .hidden _ZN5repro7test_fn17hf3114ef58d23fd06E
0000000000000000         *UND*	0000000000000000 .hidden _ZN5repro7test_fn17hf3114ef58d23fd06E
0000000000000000         *UND*	0000000000000000 .hidden _ZN5repro7test_fn17hf3114ef58d23fd06E
```

Then if you try to link this rlib into a binary you get a linking error for missing symbols.

If you modify the command line to not use `-Copt-level=3` you get fewer symbols but it remains undefined. Command lines:
```
../../third_party/android_rust_toolchain/toolchain/bin/rustc repro.rs \
  --crate-type rlib --edition=2018 -o repro.rlib

objdump -t repro.rlib |grep test_fn|grep UND
```
Result:
```
0000000000000000         *UND*	0000000000000000 .hidden _ZN5repro11run_test_fn28_$u7b$$u7b$closure$u7d$$u7d$17h3de3c5199c06a2ddE
```
### Notes
- It also repros with 2021 edition.
- I'm using the toolchain here: https://android.googlesource.com/platform/prebuilts/rust.git

I believe this is different from https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/47384 as the missing symbol is not the static initializer, it's a function calling a non-inlined function. And this is all happening in the crate root.

### Meta
`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.58.1-dev
binary: rustc
commit-hash: unknown
commit-date: unknown
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.58.1-dev
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```
